noun.description: A member of an early Christian or Gnostic sect, believed to have allowed its members to participate in pagan ceremonies. Also generally: a married priest, an opponent of clerical celibacy.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the Nicolaitans or their views; paganistic, libertine.

origin: Early 16th century; earliest use found in The New Testament. From Nicolaite + -an.
